name: EPIC 246851721
scenarioDescription:
The EPIC 246851721 Exoplanetary System


Overview

EPIC 246851721 is a star with 1.32 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.59 times its radius. It is located 1098.167252 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3.02 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

EPIC 246851721 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the EPIC 246851721 system

EPIC 246851721 b

EPIC 246851721 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the Transit method. The mass of EPIC 246851721 b is 953.49 times the mass of Earth. The radius of EPIC 246851721 b is 11.781 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, EPIC 246851721 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, EPIC 246851721 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system EPIC 246851721, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by K2.
